tic, travis and usethis - an overview

Patrick Schratz, Kirill Müller

Source: vignettes/tic-usethis-travis.Rmd
tic-usethis-travis.Rmd

The following diagram shows how the packages tic, travis and usethis are connected:

The usethis package holds all the utility wrapper functions to simplify R package development. From cloning a GitHub repo (create_from_github()) over using roxygen2 for documentation purposes (use_roxygen()) to setting up CI for your package (use_ci()). The latter effectively calls a mixture of travis and tic functions that do the work in the background.

Most of the work that needs to be done for Travis is handled by the travis package. These are tasks like enabling the repo in travis-ci.org, setting up SSH deployment keys for your repo on Travis and others.

After everything is set up, usethis and travis have done their jobs and the rest of the work goes to tic. By this we mean the handling of the actual CI workflow: Which steps are going to be run, how the deployment is handled and so on.

In summary, the interaction is as follows:

  • usethis: Package containing utility wrapper functions to simplify R package development, including use_ci().

  • travis: Responsible for setting up all CI related tasks and taking care of permissions.

  • tic: Package to specify the CI workflow (which stages are run, which commands are used).

tic is a part of . Learn more at ropensci.org.

Developed by Kirill Müller, Mika Braginsky, Karthik Ram, Jeroen Ooms, Patrick Schratz, rOpenSci. Site built by pkgdown & rotemplate.
